alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 10:06AM EST until further notice by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-270315- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.W.0017.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.220223T1516Z.220227T0600Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1006 AM EST Sat Feb 26 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Saturday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.3 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 09/10/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
